description: Stray, the action-adventure game where you play as a cat, is reportedly coming to PS Plus in November. According to a leak, the game will joing PS Plus Essential tier on November 4. Stray released on PC and PlayStation in 2022 and later launched on Xbox in 2023.
title: Cat Adventure Game Stray is Reportedly Coming to PS Plus Essential in November

description: Oppo Find X9 Pro is the company's latest Find-series flagship device, featuring Hasselblad-tuned cameras. The phone is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9500 SoC and features vapour chamber cooling. The smartphone has a minimalist design and is rated IP66, IP68, and IP69. In our limited time, we found the handset snappy and the camera capable. We will talk more about the performance, camera and battery in our review.
title: Oppo Find X9 Pro First Impressions

description: Oppo Find X9 Pro was launched globally during the company's event in Barcelona, Spain, alongside the standard Find X9. Both handsets were initially only available in China. Both handsets are powered by the same MediaTek Dimensity 9500 chipset, paired with up to 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM and up to 512GB of UFS 4.1 internal storage. While the two carry Hasselblad-tuned 50-megapixel triple-rear camera setups, the Pro model gets a 200-megapixel telephoto camera instead of the 50-megapixel telephoto lens on the standard model. The Find X9 Pro and Find X9 pack 7,500mAh and 7,025mAh batteries, respectively.
title: Oppo Find X9 Pro Launched With 7,500mAh Battery, 200-Megapixel Telephoto Camera Alongside Find X9: Price, Features

description: Adobe has partnered with YouTube to make Premiere for iOS a central hub for Shorts creators, offering seamless import, editing, and direct publishing to YouTube. The workflow is optimised for short-form, vertical videos to help creators produce content faster. The move complements Adobe’s broader rollout of new AI tools across its creative platforms.
title: Adobe Will Now Let You Edit YouTube Shorts on the Premiere App

description: Ant Group, the Alibaba-backed fintech powerhouse, has registered the “Antcoin” trademark in Hong Kong through its Cayman Islands subsidiary. The move underlines the firm’s intent to pursue blockchain-based innovation in friendlier jurisdictions as Beijing tightens its control over cryptocurrency activity and limits private digital asset projects across mainland China.
title: Ant Group Registers ‘Antcoin’ Trademark in Hong Kong as China Tightens Crypto Rules

description: Coinbase has joined forces with Wall Street major Citi to improve the functionality and efficiency of stablecoin transactions. The partnership focuses on easing conversions between fiat and digital currencies while enhancing cross-border payment systems. Citi’s involvement highlights a growing institutional push towards blockchain-based finance, as major banks prepare for the GENIUS Act, which will regulate stablecoins starting in 2027.
title: Coinbase Partners Citi to Boost Stablecoin Adoption Amidst Growing Institutional Interest

description: A new TD Cowen investor note contradicts earlier claims that Apple is cutting iPhone Air production. The firm reports that Apple’s plans remain unchanged, with 3 million units set for Q3 2025 and 7 million for Q4 2025, while overall iPhone 17 builds are projected at 54 million and 79 million, respectively. TD Cowen notes that production adjustments often reflect shifting demand, not weak sales. This outlook contrasts with a Nikkei Asia report suggesting Apple reduced iPhone Air output due to sluggish demand outside China.
title: iPhone Air Production Reportedly Remains Unchanged Amidst Speculation of Manufacturing Cuts

description: WhatsApp could soon allow normal users to keep cover photos on their accounts. The inclusion of the cover image feature was spotted on the WhatsApp 2.25.32.2 beta for Android version, via the Google Play Beta programme. The feature is not visible to beta testers. Once rolled out, this feature will let users express their personality through a customisable cover photo. It will be displayed as a prominent banner at the top of the profile.
title: WhatsApp Might Soon Let You Set a Profile Cover Photo, Just Like Facebook and LinkedIn

description: Adobe has unveiled a major lineup of AI upgrades across Photoshop, Express, and Firefly, including new AI assistants and audio-video generation tools. The update introduces Firefly Image Model 5 with multi-layered editing, custom Firefly training for individuals, and integrations with ElevenLabs and Topaz. These features mark Adobe’s biggest step yet in blending creative control with generative AI.
title: Adobe Introduces AI Assistant in Photoshop, New AI Audio and Video Tools in Firefly

description: With the rise in air pollution levels in India, heavy particulate matter and toxic gases can make their way inside your home, entering the air you breathe and posing a long-term health hazard. In such situations, an air purifier is a crucial smart home appliance to own, to ensure the safety of yourself and your loved ones. There are several factors you need to keep in mind while purchasing an air purifier.
title: Best Air Purifiers Under Rs. 20,000: 5 Things to Check Before You Buy

description: Realme is gearing up to launch the C85 Pro globally, with teasers already live in Vietnam. The smartphone is expected to feature a 7,000mAh battery with two-day backup, IP69-rated dust and water resistance, and AI-powered features. A Geekbench listing with model number RMX5555 reveals the Snapdragon 685 chipset, Adreno 610 GPU, 8GB RAM, and Android 15-based Realme UI 6. The phone will likely also support 45W fast charging and come in Black, Green, and Purple colour options with a 50-megapixel dual rear camera setup.
title: Realme C85 Pro Reportedly Listed on Geekbench With Snapdragon 685 SoC, Android 15

description: Samsung is working on One UI 8.5, even as it continues rolling out Android 16-based One UI 8 to current flagship devices. Expected to launch early next year, One UI 8.5 will reportedly introduce new Pro camera presets. These presets will reportedly be shareable with other Galaxy users via the Quick Share app.
title: Samsung Reportedly Working on Pro Camera Presets With Quick Share Support With One UI 8.5 Update

description: Snapdragon 8 Gen 6 chipset could support up to LPDDR 6 RAM and UFS 5.0 storage, according to a tipster. If this is true, then the rumoured SoC, which is expected to launch next year, could offer significant upgrades over Qualcomm's current flagship 3nm Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5, which supports up to LPDDR5X RAM. Moreover, the company is tipped to use TSMC's N2P technology to fabricate the chip. Various reports suggest that Apple and Samsung are also developing 2nm chips, dubbed A20 and Exynos 2600, respectively.
title: Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6 Tipped to Support LPDDR6 RAM, UFS 5.0 Storage

description: US Representative Ro Khanna has announced plans to introduce a bill that would ban the President, members of Congress, and their families from owning, trading, or creating cryptocurrencies. The move aims to prevent conflicts of interest amid growing concerns about political links to the crypto industry, including allegations around Trump’s family and Binance co-founder Changpeng Zhao’s pardon. The proposal seeks to restore public trust in government integrity.
title: US Lawmaker Proposes Bill to Ban Elected US Officials From Trading Crypto

description: Anthropic has introduced Claude for Excel, a new integration that lets users analyse and automate spreadsheet tasks directly through a Claude sidebar. The update also adds six finance-focused agentic skills and new data connectors for real-time access to sources like LSEG, Moody’s, and MT Newswires. These are currently available as research previews.
title: Anthropic Releases Microsoft Excel Support in Claude, Adds New Agentic Skills for Financial Tasks

description: A new report has shed light on the future of Xbox consoles. The next-gen Xbox will reportedly be a Windows-based device with a TV-optimised Xbox interface on top. The next Xbox will support other storefronts like Steam, Epic Games Store, among others.
title: Next-Gen Xbox Will Reportedly Run Windows With a TV-Optimised Interface on Top, Support Steam

description: Redmi Turbo 5 will launch early next year, a report recently highlighted. While the Xiaomi sub-brand has yet to confirm its rumoured launch, various specifications of the phone have surfaced online. The supposed successor of the Redmi Turbo 4, it could sport a 6.5-inch LTPS display with 1.5K resolution. Moreover, it could be powered by a MediaTek Dimensity 8500-Ultra chipset, paired with a 7,500mAh battery. It might support 100W wired fast charging, too.
title: Redmi Turbo 5 Tipped to Launch With 7,500mAh Battery, 6.5-Inch 1.5K LTPS Display

description: A new chipset, Exynos S6568, has surfaced on the Bluetooth SIG website. The listing shows that it will serve as a companion chip for Samsung’s Exynos application processors. It’s described as a complete Bluetooth + Wi-Fi solution, supporting the upcoming Bluetooth 6.1 standard. It could be used for enhancing connectivity in the Galaxy S26 series.
title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Series Could Feature a Dedicated Exynos Connectivity Chip

description: The Powerbeats Fit features a unique secure-fit wingtip design ideal for fitness enthusiasts. It features decent ANC and gets native support for Apple devices. On the other hand, Android users can download the Beats app to use features like one-touch pairing, customisable controls, battery status, Locate My Beats, and even a Fit Test. At Rs. 24,900, the Powerbeats Fit is a great daily companion for the gym, but it faces competition from the AirPods Pro 3 and even its bigger sibling, the Powerbeats Pro 2.
title: Beats Powerbeats Fit Review: Compact Fitness Earbuds?

description: Lava Mobiles teased the launch of a new smartphone in India via social media on Tuesday. While details about the upcoming model remain under wraps, it is speculated to be the Lava Agni 4, whose launch timeline has already been confirmed by the brand. A company official further provided fuel to the fire with a social media post, which teased the launch of the Lava Agni 4 in the country. We can expect more details to surface closer to the launch of the Lava Agni 4.
title: Lava Teases Upcoming Smartphone Launch in India; Lava Agni 4 Likely to Make Its Debut Soon

description: OpenAI has detailed its new safety evaluation system to detect signs of mental health distress, suicidal thoughts, and emotional dependence on ChatGPT. The company says the mechanism, built with input from clinicians and psychologists, helps its AI de-escalate sensitive chats and guide users to professional help. Critics, however, argue this approach risks moral policing and infringes on user autonomy.
title: OpenAI Explains How It Assesses Mental Health Concerns of ChatGPT Users, Sparks Backlash

description: Oppo is set to launch the Find X9 series globally today alongside ColorOS 16 and has confirmed its upcoming India launch with a dedicated microsite. The Find X9 and X9 Pro will debut in Titanium Grey, Space Black, Silk White, and Titanium Charcoal shades. Oppo will also release the Enco Buds 3 Pro+ and the Hasselblad Teleconverter Kit in India. Indian buyers can access exclusive Rs. 99 Privilege Pack benefits and an exchange program offering up to Rs. 18,130 for select devices.
title: Oppo Find X9 Series India Launch Teased Hours Ahead of Global Debut; Exchange Offers, Other Benefits Revealed

description: A new leak suggests Apple has completed testing its solid-state button technology, paving the way for mass production with the iPhone 20 series in 2027. These buttons, including power, volume, action, and camera, will likely simulate clicks using localised haptic feedback instead of physical movement, improving durability and water resistance. The transition may reportedly begin with the iPhone 18 in 2026, where the camera button will shift to a pressure-sensing design before adopting piezoelectric ceramic feedback in later models.
title: Apple's iPhone 20 to Feature All Solid-State Haptic Buttons in 2027, Tipster Claims

description: EA has announced Battlefield Redsec, the free-to-play Battle Royale mode for Battlefield 6. The game will launch on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series S/X on October 28, alongside Season 1 of post-launch content. Battlefield Redsec will support 100 players across a single, expansive map.
title: Battlefield Redsec, Battlefield 6's Free-to-Play Battle Royale Mode, Arrives October 28

description: Bitcoin traded slightly lower on Tuesday, slipping below $114,000 (roughly Rs. 1 crore) as investors awaited the US Federal Reserve’s policy announcement. A mix of cautious sentiment, profit booking, and global macro uncertainties kept traders on edge. Meanwhile, Ethereum and other major altcoins followed suit, recording mild corrections amid low-risk appetite and volatile conditions across global crypto markets.
title: Bitcoin Slips Below $114,000 as Traders Remain Cautious Amidst Market Uncertainty

description: OpenAI reportedly announced on Tuesday that it will provide one year of free access to ChatGPT Go to all Indian users. As per the report, the exclusive access is being provided ahead of the company’s first DevDay Exchange event scheduled for November 4.
title: ChatGPT Go to Be Free for All Indian Users for One Year Soon, Says OpenAI: Report

description: Google is launching a public preview of its Gemini-powered Fitbit Personal Health Coach on October 28 for Fitbit Premium users in the US. The AI-based assistant combines fitness, sleep, and wellness guidance within a redesigned Fitbit app featuring new sections and an “Ask Coach” option. Users can chat naturally to receive personalised plans and insights. Initially available only on Android, the preview will expand to iOS later. Google plans a full rollout next year, further integrating AI into personalised health tracking.
title: Google Says Fitbit AI Health Coach Uses Gemini Models for Adaptive Coaching

description: Apple is reportedly working to pack 12GB RAM in the base iPhone 18 model. This could be an upgrade from the 8GB available in the iPhone 17. Apple is also said to be in talks with supplier Samsung to increase the supply of LPDDR5X chips. It is also said to be in talks with SK Hynix and Micron for additional mobile DRAM supply.
title: iPhone 18 Will Reportedly Arrive With Significant RAM Upgrade Over iPhone 17

description: iQOO Neo 11, the successor to last year’s iQOO Neo 10, is set to debut in China on October 30. The handset will be offered in at least two colourways. While most of the specifications are still under wraps, the company has now confirmed that the phone will ship with a Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, paired with an LPDDR5X Ultra RAM and UFS 4.1 storage. It will also get an 8K VC cooling solution to prevent the phone from overheating. This comes days after the phone was found testing on Geekbench with Android 16 and 16GB of RAM.
title: iQOO Neo 11 Confirmed to Launch With Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC, 8K VC Cooling Solution

description: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 8 will launch next year with S-Pen support, according to a report. The handset is expected to pack a 5,000mAh battery, which would be an upgrade over the Galaxy Z Fold 7's 4,400mAh battery. This year's flagship foldable from the South Korean tech giant does not feature stylus support to achieve a thin form factor. Recently, a report revealed that the company is working on bringing back S-Pen support for its flagship phones.
title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 8 Said to Feature Larger Battery, Reintroduce S-Pen Support

description: Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold was showcased by the company at the APEC Summit on Tuesday. The handset is expected to be available only in select global markets, such as China, South Korea, and the UAE. It appears to have three side-by-side screens which can be folded in a Z-style. The right-most screen is equipped with an in-display hole-punch front camera for selfies.
title: Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold Officially Showcased at APEC Summit Ahead of Launch: Report

description: Wobble is all set to launch its first smartphone in India next month. The in-house brand of Bengaluru-based Indkal Technologies currently has display and smart TVs in its portfolio. The new phone will be positioned in the premium segment. It is expected to run on the MediaTek Dimensity 7400 5G chipset and could be equipped with 8GB of RAM.
title: Wobble Announces Launch Date for First Smartphone in India: Expected Specifications, Features

description: Google Chrome for Android is getting Google's new Material 3 Expressive Design with version 141. The server-side update, which started rolling out in late August, has now been completed. It brings a new look to the browser, with a refreshed three-dot menu and redesigned Bookmark icon. While Chrome has incorporated Material 3 Expressive elements, it hasn’t reportedly increased button sizes.
title: Chrome for Android Finally Adopts Google’s Material 3 Expressive Design Language With Latest Update

description: Elon Musk has launched Grokipedia, an AI-powered encyclopedia that aims to offer a “truth-focused” alternative to Wikipedia. Currently live as version 0.1, the open-source site hosts around 8,85,000 articles maintained entirely by Grok AI, without human editing. Musk claims it’s already “better than Wikipedia,” although critics note that several entries appear copied or adapted from Wikipedia itself.
title: Elon Musk Launches Grokipedia v0.1, an AI-Powered Rival to Wikipedia

description: Fitbit's personal health coach app's public preview will start rolling out to eligible Android users today, Google announced in a blog post on Monday. The current version brings a new Gemini AI-powered Ask Coach feature, allowing users to have a conversation with the chatbot. The public preview version will start with a conversation, where the company is asking users to share information about themselves to get personalised fitness goals. According to a report, Google will start rolling out the full version of the health coach in 2026.
title: Fitbit Health Coach Preview Rolls Out With AI Chatbot; Google to Launch New Fitbit Hardware in 2026

description: iQOO 15 will be launched in India next month, the company announced via social media on Tuesday. The upcoming handset, arriving as the successor to the iQOO 13, is confirmed to be powered by Qualcomm’s flagship Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chipset. While specifications remain under wraps, a company official has teased that it will be powered by Android 16-based OriginOS 6. The iQOO 15, notably, was introduced in China on October 20.
title: iQOO 15 India Launch Date Announced; Will Feature Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 Chipset

description: Amazon is planning to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs beginning on Tuesday, as the company pares expenses and compensates for overhiring during the peak demand of the pandemic, according to three people familiar with the matter.
title: Amazon Said to Cut as Many as 30,000 Corporate Jobs Starting This Week

description: Elon Musk confirmed that a major bug in X’s “For You” algorithm caused users to see fewer posts from accounts they follow, adding that a fix is on the way. He also announced a new “Following” feed option that will let users choose between viewing all posts or only key highlights. Additionally, Musk revealed that X’s recommendation system will soon be powered by the Grok AI chatbot, which will analyse posts and videos to deliver more personalised content and boost smaller creators’ visibility.
title: Elon Musk Promises Fix for X Algorithm Bug That Showed Users Fewer Posts From Accounts They Follow

description: The Oppo Find X9 series is all set to be launched in the global markets, including India, today (October 28), comprise two models — Oppo Find X9 and Find X9 Pro. The company has revealed several details about its upcoming flagship handsets in the days leading up to the launch. They are expected to come with similar specifications to their Chinese counterparts, such as a MediaTek's new Dimensity 9500 chipset.
title: Oppo Find X9 Series Launching Today: How to Watch Livestream, Expected Features and Specifications

description: Qualcomm on Monday unveiled two artificial intelligence chips for data centers that will be available in 2026. The chipmaker said the new chips support common AI frameworks and tools and played up cost-savings for enterprises. The company also unveiled racks based on the new chips, as Nvidia and AMD move from selling chips to providing larger data center systems.
title: Qualcomm Announces New AI Chips in Data Center Push, Shares Surge

description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a massive data breach involving tens of millions of leaked Gmail accounts. According to a report, the breach occurred in April of this year and was recently made public, with a record of over 183 million credentials in total. It not only includes email accounts, but also the passwords that are associated with them. The data breach is reportedly part of a larger stealer ecosystem, typically resulting from malware on the victim's machine.
title: Massive Data Breach Leaves 183 Million Email Credentials, Including Gmail Passwords, Exposed: Report
